info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 9:50PM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Nashville TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County.
For the Duck River...including Hurricane Mills...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Duck River near Hurricane Mills.
* WHEN...From this evening until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Portions of Tumbling Creek Road east of Highway 13 are flooded to a depth of 2 feet and may be impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 20.2 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CDT Thursday was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 21.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall Saturday evening. It will rise to 23.0 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 400 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY
